owner.description: Contact person for this contract. Email address.

description.description: The description of the dataset.  What does each row represent?

name.description: The name of the column as in the SQL warehouse

description.description: The description to be used anywhere this column is shown to users

data_type.description: The SQL data type as in the warehouse

optional.description: When set to true, the schema check will not fail if the column is not present. Default is required.

checks.description: A list of checks for this dataset executed by a Soda

type.description: The type of the check, usually this is the name of the metric

name.description: The display name for the check used in Soda Cloud and other UI tools

missing_values.description: Customized list of missing values. NULL is always considered missing so that does not have to be specified. If no customization is needed, consider specifying not_null:true instead. Implies a missing_count check in Soda.

missing_sql_regex.description: Customized SQL regex to identify missing values. The flavor of regex depends on the SQL engine / warehouse. NULL is always considered missing so that does not have to be specified. Implies a missing_count check in Soda.

valid_values.description: A list of valid values. Only supports all strings or all numbers. Implies an invalid_count check in Soda.

valid_sql_regex.description: A SQL regular expression that matches valid values. Implies a valid_count check in Soda. All (in)valid_* configs are combined in a single invalid_count check.

valid_format.description: A named regular expression that specifies valid values.

valid_length.description: The exact length of values. Only for text data types. Implies an invalid_count check in Soda. Also consider valid_min_length & valid_max_length.

valid_max_length.description: The maximum length of values. Only for text data types. Implies an invalid_count check in Soda.

valid_min_length.description: The minimum length of values. Only for text data types. Implies an invalid_count check in Soda.

valid_min.description: The minimum allowed value. Only for numeric data types or text types with a numeric format. Implies an invalid_count check in Soda.

valid_max.description: The maximum allowed value. Only for numeric data types or text types with a numeric format. Implies an invalid_count check in Soda.

invalid_values.description: A list of valid values. Only supports all strings or all numbers. Implies an invalid_count check in Soda.

invalid_sql_regex.description: A regular expression that specifies valid values.

invalid_format.description: A named regular expression that specifies invalid values.

filter_sql_expression.description: Specifies a sql expression filter that should be applied on the metric

must_be.description: YY The value the check metric (as specified in the type) must have for the check to pass; The check passes if the metric has the specified value, and fails otherwise; https://docs.soda.io/#thresholds

must_not_be.description: The value that the check metric (as specified in the type) may not have. The check passes if the metric doesn't have this value and fails otherwise.

must_be_greater_than.description: Specifies the threshold for the check. The check fails if the metric value is greater than the specified threshold value.

must_be_greater_than_or_equal_to.description: Specifies the threshold for the check. The check fails if the metric value is greater than or equal to the specified threshold value.

must_be_less_than.description: Specifies the threshold for the check. The check fails if the metric value is less than the specified threshold value.

must_be_less_than_or_equal_to.description: Specifies the threshold for the check. The check fails if the metric value is less than or equal to the specified threshold value.

must_be_between.description: Specifies a threshold range for the check. The check fails if the metric value is between a minimum and maximum value. In short style eg fail_when_between:[10,20] boundary values 10 and 20 will pass. For including boundary values, use nested min_* and max_* properties

must_not_be_between.description: Specifies a threshold range for the check. The check fails if the metric value is not between a minimum and maximum value. In short style eg fail_when_between:[10,20] boundary values 10 and 20 will pass. For including boundary values, use nested min_* and max_* properties
